Where the path crosses these dips, the moist earth slightly gives way underfoot. The drone of mosquitoes has replaced the humming of wild honeybees, and the air feels warm and humid.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, Lower Slopes
node.description: Signs of wildlife are everywhere: squirrels scamper in a stunted elm, rabbit warrens hide in its roots, and the trails of small game lead off into the brush around it. To the west stands a low knoll that offers a way around the bottoms to the southwest and an escape from the clinging mud.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, Lower Slopes
node.description: At the top of a firm, dry knoll, a curious oak with twin trunks rises high into the air. Its high, dense crown has held down the undergrowth and allows a view to the west of what looks like an upthrust cliff. The cliff itself is hard to distinguish from the surrounding vegetation because of its own thick covering.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, Lower Slopes
node.description: Over the years, water has soaked a deep depression between the hills, making every step a chore. In the dark water, a silvery cypress tree stands like a monarch, scores of roots and knees anchoring it, its limbs covered with moss and vines, reaching up toward the trees on the surrounding hillsides.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, Lower Slopes
node.description: A massive cypress grows on a slight rise just above the waterline. Its upper branches form a second storey high above the forest floor. Occasionally something stirs in the canopy above, sometimes raining a shower of leaves and twigs, but nothing ever seems to show its face.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, Lower Slopes
node.description: One of the younger cypress trees stands near the bottom of a slight rise of the land, small only by comparison with the giants to the east, yet one of the few that doesn't seem wrapped in vines. Still, the lower branches are within reach, and it looks climbable.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, Lower Slopes
node.description: The sound of water splashing comes from the northwest. A stream curves out from around the base of the outcropping of rock, heading south toward the marsh. Here at its base, where the cliff looms high overhead, the trees are noticeably thinner than the bigger ones to the northeast.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, Lower Slopes
node.description: A good hundred feet up, a small stream of water spills over the edge of the cliff. It has worn a slippery channel down the slope, but the channel looks far too slick and steep to climb. The run-off gathers in pools along the path before seeping into the surrounding bog.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, Lower Slopes
node.description: On the border between the forest giants and lesser trees, water trickles along the ground in innumerable ribbons, heading generally south. The path is nearly mud, and walking is difficult as it winds among the bushes and vines that swarm up the face of the outcrop. And the mosquitoes are especially hungry.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, Lower Slopes
node.description: The path has become a yielding muck, hampering movement but not greatly slowing it. Swarms of the tiny black flies that breed in the marsh are more numerous, almost everywhere, and they all seem to be just at eye-level. Still lower ground lies through a thicket to the southwest.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, Lower Slopes
node.description: To the west looms a great outcropping of rock, tinted green and grey with moss. Great trees rise in all other directions but southwest. On that side, the ground slopes down to a wet, marshy bog, out of which comes a din of frogs croaking and insects buzzing.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, Lower Slopes
node.description: A curious mixture of trees and undergrowth lines the trail: where the path rises, the ground is a bit firmer and drier, with oaks predominating. But in the hollows, the going is slower, the earth damp and yielding, and alder and willow saplings thrive. To the south and west, the land is lower still.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, Lower Slopes
node.description: A fallen log lies across the path, sunk half-way in the moist ground. Moss covers its trunk, softening the outlines, and its upper branches are coated with a hard, white fungus. A puddle has collected on the eastern, upslope side of the trunk.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Stunted Elm
node.description: Not many elms populate the forest. This one must have been a volunteer sprung from a seed carried by a far-flying bird. It hasn't thrived in its setting, short on water and sunlight, and the vines trailing from the taller trees add yet another obstacle.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Twin Oak
node.description: The two trunks of the oak are so close together that from a distance they appear to be one. Their branches are flourishing, and several of the larger limbs seem almost trunk-like themselves. They fork into something very close to a natural lair for the small -- and the larger -- predators of the forest.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Twin Oak
node.description: Here and there on the bark of the limb are little tufts of grey fur, the kind that a cat might leave behind if it was lying on its back scratching an itch. The main difference is that the hairs are twice as long as any cat's, and the tufts cover a wide surface. The trunk also shows deep scores, as if it had been used as a scratching post by impressive claws.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Twin Oak
node.description: This limb of the oak hangs high above a little stream that winds its way down the hillside. The splash of the water is pleasant, and a dip might be refreshing, but the stream is obviously shallow, and no convenient vines allow an easy or safe descent.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Twin Oak
node.description: The tree has been lavish with its seed, and acorns and acorn caps litter the boughs. Its resident red squirrels are especially sleek and sassy, springing from branch to branch in a world where food is abundant, shelter is free, and life is easy.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Silvery Cypress
node.description: Broad branches in many directions make a firm floor underfoot. Shapes and shadows waver and change in the darkness. Sheets of silvery moss billow and ripple, like tent walls pierced with windows of curious shapes. A dwarf seems to be peering through one of those windows to the northeast.

Broad branches in many directions make a firm floor underfoot. Light filtering down through the leaves lends a color of enchantment, annihilating all that's made into a green thought in a green shade. Sheets of silvery moss billow and ripple, like tent walls pierced with windows of curious shapes. A dwarf seems to be peering through one of those windows to the northeast.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Silvery Cypress
node.description: Nature's mischievous hand has left its mark at the joint of two big branches: the wrinkles in the bark bear a striking resemblance to a Dwarven face. No sculptor could have bettered the swellings that form the beetling brows and the bulbous nose, complete with wart. A fold supplies a broad smile, and the greenish moss provides a luxuriant beard.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Silvery Cypress
node.description: The branch takes a sharp, sudden bend, possibly in a direction set when the tree was young, and the limb grew toward a patch of sunlight. The obscuring moss partly masks the turn, and an unwary traveller risks a dangerous fall.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Silvery Cypress
node.description: The pleasant scent of living cypress wood is overlaid by a heavier, spicy aroma, possibly the silver-shaded moss that covers this tree alone of those that stand on the slope. Vines weave in and out of the moss, connecting the branches of neighboring trees in a complicated network. Judging from scuff marks on the boughs, some of the vines are routes as well marked as the paths on the ground below.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Silvery Cypress
node.description: Through some odd effect of the tangle of vines or the lay of the land, the whisper of the wind is louder here, and every sparrow's chirp and mosquito's buzz is ten times magnified. Through the maze of creepers and moss, the outline of a huge cypress can be seen to the west, and some of the vines close at hand disappear into its upper branches.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, A Massive Cypress
node.description: The cypress stands regally among its fellows, its girth and height showing its victories in the slow, unceasing forest battles with weather and rivals. Here a storm has broken a branch, there a vine has strangled a limb, but the cypress has overcome them all, and stretches its crown above the knoll it rules.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, A Massive Cypress
node.description: This perch on a wide limb of the cypress stands well above the leafy canopy, and commands a panoramic view. The thick forest rolls upslope to the higher ground to the east and descends steeply to a swamp in the south. In the west, a steep spur of rock hides the river from view. A supple vine close at hand trails over to a silvery cypress.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, A Massive Cypress
node.description: Pink flowers with a cloud of feathery petals dot the end of the branch, a startling sight on a cypress. A closer look shows that the flowers only appear to be sprouting from the limb: they are blossoming on a dark green vine swooping down to a smaller, younger cypress.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Young Cypress
node.description: High above the knees of the cypress, a wide limb offers firm footing to the creatures who spend most of their lives among its leaves. They are born, hunt, mate, and die in this green world above the forest floor.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Young Cypress
node.description: The wide limb spreads its branches to either side, moss cascading in grey-green strands to left and right. A world of birds and beetles, caracals, squirrels and snakes -- a whole aerial menagerie -- whistles, growls, chitters, and hisses a welcome.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Young Cypress
node.description: The limb of the cypress tapers, and with each step it flexes underfoot. This aerial path is clearly at an end, but a cluster of vines from nearby trees entangles the end of the bough like a weaver's nightmare. One sturdy vine in particular drapes over from a massive cypress.

node.name: A Massive Cypress, A Leafy Hut
node.description: Someone has built a shelter from the elements against the trunk of the cypress. Leafy branches have been skillfully woven into the limbs of the tree to make walls and a roof, as snug a room as one might wish.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Bog Wallows
node.description: A grove of cypress trees of all sizes spreads in all directions, rooted in the soft, wet bog. Insects hum and buzz, bubbles rise from the ooze and pop with every step, and unfamiliar cries of birds or animals sound on all sides. A bramble thicket on a slight rise running northeast to west, or possibly an opening in the trees to the southeast, looks like the only chance of dry, firm footing.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Bog Wallows
node.description: A game trail, a path for something between the size of a badger and a deer, struggles through a patch of dense underbrush. The path is wide and well-trampled, but to each side, saplings as thick as an arm have been broken off and scored with deep gouges.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Bog Wallows
node.description: A fair-sized clearing allows a view of the night sky. One of the giant cypresses has fallen, pulling its neighboring trees down with it, and the tangled remains of broken trunks and shattered limbs are slowly sinking into the mire. Spindly saplings sprout in the gaping hole, waiting for the sun to rise again.

A fair-sized clearing allows the light to reach this one small part of the bog. One of the giant cypresses has fallen, pulling its neighboring trees down with it, and the tangled remains of broken trunks and shattered limbs are slowly sinking into the mire. Spindly saplings sprout in the gaping hole and struggle to capture the precious sunlight.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Bog Wallows
node.description: A gnarled cypress, bent into a wooden parody of a giant bowed under a heavy burden, stands in the muddy soil. The tree even bears something that resembles a wound: a gash has been ripped into the bark along one side. Beyond it to the west is a large pool of dirty brown water, home to who knows what kind of creatures.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Bog Wallows
node.description: Scum-covered waters swirl around a moss-shrouded cypress standing in a murky brown pool. Unknown and unseen inhabitants lurking below the surface stir the water, from which an everpresent fog slowly twists and dances despite the deathly still air. Rumors say the fog holds the spirits of the fallen, forever trapped in the mist.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Bog Wallows
node.description: The water deepens, making the footing even more uncertain in front of a large cypress tree slowly being strangled by greyish-green vines with big, plate-sized leaves. The vines drape the tree like a shroud and will eventually pull it down, but for the creature that climbs the tree, they offer a secure handhold, almost as good as a ladder.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Bog Wallows
node.description: From the west comes the noise of rushing water -- no small stream, by the sound of it. Here, in the midst of a thicket of alder and willow trees, the water is still and knee-deep in some places, but a path can be traced by stepping carefully across the roots of the trees.

From the west comes the noise of rushing water -- no small stream, by the sound of it. Here, in the midst of a thicket of alder and willow trees, the water is still and knee-deep in some places, but a path can be traced by stepping carefully across the roots of the trees. A shaft of sunlight flashes a reflection from something at the base of a willow.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Bog Wallows
node.description: A thicket of alder surrounds a big willow tree, then stretches off to the east -- a pleasantly shady resting spot if the biting flies ever left the swamp. Occasionally, the wind blows fresh air and the smell of life from across the Altanen, momentarily masking the reek of the bog. A piece of cloth caught in some ravelthorn bushes flutters in the breeze, near a trail following the rising ground north along the river.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Bog Wallows
node.description: A rocky outcropping like a tilted tabletop stretches far to the north to a jagged peak jutting into the sky. Through the ravelthorn bushes to the south and west comes the continuous roaring of the Altanen River.

A rocky outcropping like a tilted tabletop stretches far to the north to a jagged peak jutting into the sky. Through the ravelthorn bushes to the south and west comes the flash of sunbeams on the Altanen River.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Bog Wallows
node.description: On the crest of a slight rise a massive white oak towers into the sky, a stalwart sentinel. The ground around the base of the tree is littered with empty acorn caps. A few slender oak saplings find purchase here and stretch to the sky but are hard pressed to find sunlight in the shade of the behemoth above them.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Bog Wallows
node.description: The trail winds between the marsh and the rocky slopes of the Forlorn Hope -- the fabled mountain, Galduta Isharon, visible to the northwest through breaks in the tress. The stench of decay hangs over the murky brown water lapping along the edge of the path.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Bog Wallows
node.description: The ground is soft underfoot, making a liquid sucking sound with every step. A discarded boot, now a permanent resident, is lodged nearby, half submerged in the mire. The surrounding woods are full of the buzz and chitter of insects, and every so often comes a rustling in the brush or something like a muffled footfall.

The ground is soft underfoot, making a liquid sucking sound with every step. A discarded boot, now a permanent resident, is lodged nearby, half submerged in the mire. The surrounding woods are full of birdsong, and every so often comes a rustling in the brush or something like a muffled footfall.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Stooping Cypress
node.description: The sad state of the cypress is even more apparent up close. The northern side of the trunk is marred by deep burns that have not yet healed. The once well-proportioned tree is crouched over, as if protecting its remaining, life-giving limb. Vines and mosses have slowly begun to cover the wounded cypress, taking advantage of its weakened state.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Stooping Cypress
node.description: The bark on the limb is well worn, as if it has been traversed frequently. The mosses and vines are dense here, hampering sight, though an overgrown platform is visible further down the limb.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Mossy Cypress
node.description: Within the folds of the mossy shrouds the air is deathly still. Sheets of moss compete with tangled vines for purchase on the steady limbs of the cypress. Despite the clinging companions, the great tree seems unhindered in its growth. It stands straight and proud, keeping endless vigil over the things that dwell in the bog.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Mossy Cypress
node.description: A dark grey moss hangs from the branches above, making footing treacherous, and soaking the traveler who pushes through its clinging, soggy curtains. Water drips down with a recurring 'plop' that adds to the cacophony of sounds. A cool breeze from the east hints at a drier perch. A weather-worn rope, nearly overgrown by the mosses, hangs from a branch higher up.

A dark grey moss hangs from the branches above, making footing treacherous and soaking the traveler who pushes through its clinging, soggy curtains. Water drips down with a recurring 'plop' that adds to the cacophony of sounds. A warm glow from the east hints at a drier perch. A weather-worn rope, nearly overgrown by the mosses, hangs from a branch higher up.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Mossy Cypress
node.description: A dry branch snaps underfoot, and silence fills the air. For a few moments not even the wind dares stir. Slowly the croaks, moans, and sounds of the bog return. A thin vine dangles here, reaching over from a stooping, worn-out cypress.

Above, the sun shines brightly though a hole in the canopy, and the moss is dry and almost brittle. A dry branch snaps underfoot, and silence fills the air. For a few moments not even the wind dares stir. Slowly the chatter and whistles of birds return. A thin vine dangles here, reaching over from a stooping, worn-out cypress.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Stooping Cypress
node.description: The ironwood platform has withstood the test of time. Despite some loose and uneven planks, neither rot nor moss mars its surface. Several scorched spots blacken the northern edges, and bent and broken arrows litter the surface. A sinuous creeper snakes across from an adjacent cypress.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Vine-covered Cypress
node.description: Midway up the tree, large vines wind about the mighty cypress like ropes around a mast. Two large limbs branch out like strong arms spread in welcome to the forest before them. From the marsh below, invisible in the darkness, come the sounds of the forest night.

Midway up the tree, big vines wind about the mighty cypress like ropes around a mast. Two large limbs branch out like strong arms spread in welcome to the forest before them. The marsh below is hidden by a sea of green leaves and fronds waving and glistening in the sunlight.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Vine-covered Cypress
node.description: Moonlight filters down through the canopy above, dappling with light and shadow a wide limb littered with twigs and leaves. A small nest of sticks and moss nestles deep in a nearby crook. Vines hang from above, draping from branch to branch in graceful, snakelike curves, some reaching to a neighboring cypress.

Sunlight filters down through the canopy above, dappling with light and shadow a wide limb littered with twigs and leaves. A small nest of sticks and moss nestles deep in a nearby crook. Vines hang from above, draping from branch to branch in graceful, snakelike curves, some reaching to a neighboring cypress.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Vine-covered Cypress
node.description: The branch threads its way through a nightmare of green strands, almost like soft, searching tentacles. While they offer no real resistance to movement, their leaves block the view of the way ahead. They wave in every breeze, threatening to distract and fray nerves already burdened with constant watchfulness.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Vine-covered Cypress
node.description: Many of the creepers that hamper the view and confound the step trail down to the ground or are so caught in branches that they might almost be a web for a monstrous spider. But something so menacing could hardly be possible. One vine looks almost designed for swinging to a nearby willow.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Vine-covered Cypress
node.description: Peat and muck cake the limb, and the smell of decaying vegetation is thick. A small clump of bog grass has taken root in the crook of the branch, a dwarfed flowering weed growing in its midst. A yellow blossom is tightly closed and curled to keep out the chill night air. It rocks back and forth in a gentle dance with the breeze.

Peat and muck cake the limb, and the smell of decaying vegetation is thick. A small clump of bog grass has taken root in the crook of the branch, a dwarfed flowering weed growing in its midst. A single yellow blossom leans toward the few beams of sunlight that make their way through the upper canopy. It rocks back and forth in a gentle dance with the breeze.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Vine-covered Cypress
node.description: The wide limb is all but invisible, completely wrapped in layer upon layer of twisting creepers. Young green tendrils wreath around it, groping for a hold on the limb. Strong vines cascade from above, reaching from tree to tree. One of the larger vines nearby disappears into a big oak tree to the north.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, A Big Willow Tree
node.description: The willow, not nearly as tall as some of the giants around it, has some of its branches tangled in a mass of vines hanging from a nearby cypress. One in particular looks like a way to get to the larger tree.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The River Bank
node.description: Soft mud underfoot, not to mention the occasional ankle-deep pool, shows that the river is lower than usual. But from the sound of flowing water, the Altanen is still wide and powerful.

The water level in the Altanen has dropped, exposing a nearly flat strip of muddy bank. To the west, a long streak of green is visible in the middle of the river, and there seems to be movement on it.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The River Bank
node.description: A strip of muddy bank lies between the river and the face of the cliff to the east. A narrow crevice splits the rock face at a steep angle, carrying a trickle of water down the mountainside.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The River Bank
node.description: The water in the Altanen ripples in the current and laps at the bank underfoot. Frogs thrum a deep bass accompaniment to the chuckle of the river.

The water in the Altanen ripples in the current and laps at the bank underfoot. Watermarks on the rock face show that the river level has dropped a foot or more, exposing a low-lying island in mid-stream about a bowshot away.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The River Bank
node.description: A shoulder of the cliff looms up to the north as the mudbank comes to an end. The sound of the river flowing past echoes from the near-vertical wall close at hand.

The mudbank ends, closed off by a shoulder of the cliff. The view across the arm of the river shows that the island, although low, is fairly long, extending a good half-league downstream. Low vegetation covers it, some kind of grey-green scrub or grass.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Altanen River
node.description: The chilly water swirls this way and that, its currents moving in the dark river without apparent purpose. To the north looms the shadowy bulk of Galduta Isharon.

To the north looms the cliff of Galduta Isharon to the east beyond the river bank, treetops rise above the mist. A low island lies further west across the channel, an easy swim through the flowing water.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Altanen River
node.description: The chilly water swirls this way and that, its currents moving in the dark river without apparent purpose. To the east looms the shadowy bulk of Galduta Isharon.

To the east looms the cliff of Galduta Isharon. A streak, apparently a fissure in the rock, runs down its face to a narrow bank at the river's edge. A low island lies further west across the channel, an easy swim through the flowing water.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Altanen River
node.description: The chilly water swirls this way and that, its currents moving in the dark river without apparent purpose. To the east looms the shadowy bulk of Galduta Isharon.

The water in the back channel flows southeast here, lapping at the shore of the low island, but smoother to the east toward the cliffs of Galduta Isharon. Except for a covering of waist-high grasses, the island looks barren.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Altanen River
node.description: The chilly water swirls this way and that, its currents moving in the dark river without apparent purpose. To the north looms the shadowy bulk of Galduta Isharon.
The shore of the island to the west lies close by, its bank receding to the northwest. Exposed by the falling river level, it's covered with grass that looks to be waist-high on a Gor'Tog.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Altanen River
node.description: The chilly water swirls this way and that, its currents moving in the dark river without apparent purpose. To the north looms the shadowy bulk of Galduta Isharon.

Swirling leaves and muddy streaks in the water show that a strong current pushes away from the swamp, apparently the outflow from the streams that feed it. Easier water lies to the west toward the island.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Altanen River
node.description: The chilly water swirls this way and that, its currents moving in the dark river without apparent purpose. To the north looms the shadowy bulk of Galduta Isharon.
The shore of the island to the west lies close by, its bank receding to the southwest. Its appearance is much like that of the swamp across the river to the east, except for an absence of trees.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Altanen River
node.description: The chilly water swirls this way and that, its currents moving in the dark river without apparent purpose.
The shore of the island to the west lies close by, its low bank presenting no obstacle. A bird circles overhead now and then, too high up to identify, but it might be a vulture.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Altanen River
node.description: The chilly water swirls this way and that, its currents moving in the dark river without apparent purpose.

The shore of the island to the west lies close by, but its bank looks undercut and higher than it is to the north. The view to the east is obscured, with only the tops of the taller trees rising above the mist.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Altanen River
node.description: The chilly water swirls this way and that, its currents moving in the dark river without apparent purpose.

The shore of the island to the west lies close by, but its steep, high bank makes reaching it impossible. The view to the east is obscured, with only the tops of the taller trees rising above the mist.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Altanen River
node.description: The chilly water swirls this way and that, its currents moving in the dark river without apparent purpose.

The two arms of the river join where it broadens at the south end of the island. To the northwest, the turbulent rapids spill their water into the confluence, slowing dramatically in a cloud of spray.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Altanen River
node.description: The air is so drenched with foaming spray, it's hard to tell where the water ends and the air begins. Confused currents push in every direction, and roaring fills the darkness, as if the elements battled for supremacy.

The water surges first in one direction then in another, bouncing around, between, and sometimes over the rocks that were once below the surface of the river. The current races along, sweeping past the banks on either side.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Altanen River
node.description: The chilly water swirls this way and that, its currents moving in the dark river without apparent purpose. To the east looms the shadowy bulk of Galduta Isharon.

To the east looms the cliff of Galduta Isharon, a narrow river bank at its base. An island lies further west, an easy swim through the flowing water. To the southeast, the trees of the Bog Wallows rise above the edge of the swamp.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Altanen River
node.description: The chilly water swirls this way and that, its currents moving in the dark river without apparent purpose. To the east looms the shadowy bulk of Galduta Isharon.

Toward the south across this arm of the river, a low scrub-covered island rises, dividing the river's flow. The swift current sends up feathers of spray where it hits the island, but the water in this back-channel is slower and smoother. To the east, a muddy strip of land lies at the foot of Galduta Isharon.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Altanen River
node.description: The chilly water swirls this way and that, its currents moving in the dark river without apparent purpose. To the east looms the shadowy bulk of Galduta Isharon.

The water in the back channel flows southeast here, lapping at the shore of the low island, but smoother to the east toward the cliffs of Galduta Isharon. Except for a covering of waist-high grasses, the island looks barren.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Altanen River
node.description: The air is so drenched with foaming spray, it's hard to tell where the water ends and the air begins. Confused currents push in every direction, and roaring fills the darkness, as if the elements battled for supremacy.

As the flow of the broad river parts around the island, this western arm forces its way between and over clusters of rocks, barely above the surface. The water races through the narrow channels, its speed and power increasing at every constriction.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Altanen River
node.description: The air is so drenched with foaming spray, it's hard to tell where the water ends and the air begins. Confused currents push in every direction, and roaring fills the darkness, as if the elements battled for supremacy.

The water surges first in one direction then in another, bouncing around, between, and sometimes over the rocks that were once below the surface of the river. The current races along, sweeping past the banks on either side.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Altanen River
node.description: The air is so drenched with foaming spray, it's hard to tell where the water ends and the air begins. Confused currents push in every direction, and roaring fills the darkness, as if the elements battled for supremacy.

The water surges first in one direction then in another, bouncing around, between, and sometimes over the rocks that were once below the surface of the river. The current races along, sweeping past the banks on either side.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The Altanen River
node.description: The air is so drenched with foaming spray, it's hard to tell where the water ends and the air begins. Confused currents push in every direction, and roaring fills the darkness, as if the elements battled for supremacy.

The water surges first in one direction then in another, bouncing around, between, and sometimes over the rocks that were once below the surface of the river. The current races along, sweeping past the banks on either side.

node.name: The Altanen River, The Island
node.description: The roar of the rapids and the wall of mist above it lend a strange boundary to the west. The buzz of a mosquito or the croak of a frog punctuates the background noise.

A narrow neck of the island curves north to southwest, covered with high grass. The rapids must be close, judging by their noise, but the quieter channel to the east shows through breaks in the grass, with places where it would be possible to get into the river.

node.name: The Altanen River, The Island
node.description: Spray from the obstructed river casts a damp smell over the island. The churning rapids to the west drown out all sound of movement through the high grasses that have sprung up to cover the island's muddy surface.

To the south from this spit of land, the Altanen has a strange appearance: a band of muddy water along the western shore, a clearer blue one along the eastern side, slowly blending as the river winds into parts unknown. Its two arms join here, holding the low, grassy island that stretches to the north. From here it could almost be a meadow or a pasture.

node.name: The Altanen River, The Island
node.description: The roar of the rapids and the wall of mist above it lend a strange boundary to the west. The buzz of a mosquito or the croak of a frog punctuates the background noise.

To the north, the island expands into a field of waving grasses, but to the south it shrinks to a narrow spit of land, barely above the surface of the water. A bowshot to east or west would reach the river, but the roaring rapids to the west show there's no escape in that direction.

node.name: The Altanen River, The Island
node.description: A faint smell of decaying vegetation -- or perhaps a fish stranded when the waters dropped -- touches the air. Swarms of insects have found a home on the island, although what they feed on is a puzzle, unless it's each other, or maybe whatever makes that snuffling sound heard now and then.

Grass extends in all directions. From here, it's easy to forget that this is an island in the middle of a great river. It looks like one could walk across this wild meadow to the trees distant in the east.

node.name: The Altanen River, The Island
node.description: A faint smell of decaying vegetation -- or perhaps a fish stranded when the waters dropped -- touches the air. Swarms of insects have found a home on the island, although what they feed on is a puzzle, unless it's each other, or maybe whatever makes that snuffling sound heard now and then.

Grass extends in all directions. From here, it's easy to forget that this is an island in the middle of a great river. It looks like one could walk across this wild meadow to the trees distant in the east.

node.name: The Altanen River, The Island
node.description: Insects drone in the dark, prey to the bat or night-flying bird whose passage is revealed by the beat of a wing. The soft splashes in the river to the east suggest that the fish are feeding too.

The animal runs in the grass, if that's what they are, cross and mingle with a bewildering complexity. An occasional waving of the grass in a purposeful direction hints that something else inhabits the island. Across the channel to east, the tops of trees rise above the mist from the river.

node.name: The Altanen River, The Island
node.description: It's hard to see much more than the clumps of grass, like huddled figures in the darkness. The splash of the rapids to the west masks all sounds.

The animal runs in the grass, if that's what they are, cross and mingle with a bewildering complexity. Taller patches here and there confuse the view as they wave in the wind and the drifting, blurring spray from the rapids to the west.

node.name: The Altanen River, The Island
node.description: Insects drone in the dark, prey to the bat or night-flying bird whose passage is revealed by the beat of a wing. The soft splashes in the river to the east suggest that the fish are feeding too.

The animal runs in the grass, if that's what they are, cross and mingle with a bewildering complexity. An occasional waving of the grass in a purposeful direction hints that something else inhabits the island. Across the channel to east, the tops of trees rise above the mist from the river.

node.name: The Altanen River, The Island
node.description: It's hard to see much more than the clumps of grass, like huddled figures in the darkness. The splash of the rapids to the west masks all sounds.

The animal runs in the grass, if that's what they are, cross and mingle with a bewildering complexity. Taller patches here and there confuse the view as they wave in the wind and the drifting, blurring spray from the rapids to the west.

node.name: The Altanen River, The Island
node.description: The roar of the rapids and the wall of mist above it lend a strange boundary to the west. The buzz of a mosquito or the croak of a frog punctuates the background noise.

To the north, the island narrows to a point, but to the south it broadens until it almost looks like a meadow covered with waving grasses. The grass is beaten down in a few places, possibly animal trails. The rapids to the west cloud the air with spray, making it hard to see what lies beyond them.

node.name: The Altanen River, The Island
node.description: Insects drone in the dark, prey to the bat or night-flying bird whose passage is revealed by the beat of a wing. The soft splashes in the river to the east suggest that the fish are feeding too.

The animal runs in the grass, if that's what they are, cross and mingle with a bewildering complexity. An occasional waving of the grass in a purposeful direction hints that something else inhabits the island. Across the channel to east, the tops of trees rise above the mist from the river.

node.name: The Altanen River, The Island
node.description: Spray from the obstructed river casts a damp smell over the island. The churning rapids to the west drown out all sound of movement through the high grasses that have sprung up to cover the island's muddy surface.

A long, low island stretches to the south, dividing the river in two. The eastern channel must be deeper, for its water is relatively smooth and unruffled, but in the western arm the lowering of the river has uncovered jagged rocks, and the water foams and races between them with a loud roar.

node.name: The Island, A Hunter's Shelter
node.description: Some thoughtful soul has dragged driftwood into a crude shelter and stuffed the larger holes with weeds. How well it keeps out the rain is anyone's guess, but it offers more protection than anywhere else on the island.

node.name: Galduta Isharon, The Outcropping
node.description: A barren, rocky clearing slopes slightly up to the north. On lower ground to the south, a heavy thicket of ravelthorns blocks the way, broken only by a few faint game trails.

node.name: Galduta Isharon, The Outcropping
node.description: On the high side of a steep ditch, the ground rises almost to the tops of the trees in the bog below. Cypress branches and tangled vines conceal the view to the south, but to the west, the way seems clearer. Already the air feels drier and cooler.

node.name: Galduta Isharon, The Outcropping
node.description: The view to the north shows a rising field of broken rock, a jumble of odd shapes and strange conjunctions. In one place, the path skirts boulders that look for all the world like trolls. In another, it avoids the smaller rubble scattered at toe-stubbing, ankle-twisting, and shin-barking heights.

node.name: Galduta Isharon, The Outcropping
node.description: The trail swings through a half-turn as it threads its way among the sharp, loose stones. A few ravelthorn bushes spring up in the soil collected on the high side of the larger stones, but for the most part, the slope is barren of plant life, left to the wind and the rain.

node.name: Galduta Isharon, The Outcropping
node.description: The trail stands at the last switch-back in its steady mounting of the hillside. Red and brown stones from the size of pebbles to cottages cover the ground, and the trail cuts back and forth between the largest of them like the path of a bouncing ball. Each Spring rain must change the path as the smaller stones wash southward to the bog.

node.name: Galduta Isharon, The Outcropping
node.description: The rock, sloping gently to the south, suddenly rises high above the treetops. A massive ridge looms against the northern sky, its front like the prow of a gigantic ship cresting the green billows of the forest. A side-trail leads off to the northeast, passing along the foot of the ridge.

node.name: Galduta Isharon, The Outcropping
node.description: The path ends at a sheer face of rock with a small pool at its base. Water from a chimney in the rock face has worn a shallow basin in the ledge, and it spills over the side, trickling down a mossy channel that drops to the ground far below. The chimney looks like it leads to higher ground above, but might be a tough climb.

node.name: Galduta Isharon, The Outcropping
node.description: A ledge hardly the width of a loaded camel ascends the west side of the rock outcropping. The fall to the river is abrupt, down a steep cliff with exposed strata of red and brown rock. On the other side of the ledge, the shoulder of the rock rises high overhead, hiding the view to the north, but to the south a marshy swamp lies in the mists.

node.name: Galduta Isharon, The West Face
node.description: The narrow ledge, barely wide enough for two people to stand side-by-side, works its way along the cliff side. Steps cut from the rock help the traveller surmount the steeper parts of the trail.

node.name: Galduta Isharon, The West Face
node.description: The trail runs through a narrow valley cut in the outcrop like a gash in its rocky skin. A grudging concession by the rugged outcropping, the trail winds its narrow route deep-set among boulders that limit sight to a few feet. A passage branches off to the northeast.

node.name: Galduta Isharon, The Outcropping
node.description: Over the millennia, the outcropping has bowed to its only master, nature: the wind has filled cracks in the rock with bits of silt and mulch from the bogs. The result is a mottled harmony of bare granite and scrub brush determined to seize life on the barren rocks. The only flaw in this example of nature's irrestible will is a patch of rusty soil at the base of one boulder, as if over the ages the elements, angry at the affront, had ground something metal under vengeful feet.

node.name: Galduta Isharon, The Outcropping
node.description: Water trickles down the face of the rocky slope from above, a soothing balm on the dry outcrop. A small lip of rock leans out over the lower elevation to the east, allowing at least a dim view downwards to dark bogs occasionally lit by a pale glow. Bits of rotting leather and pockmarked stones half buried in the thin soil show that others have done a fair amount of watching here as well.

Water trickles down the face of the rocky slope from above, a soothing balm on the dry outcrop. A small lip of rock leans out over the lower elevation to the east, allowing a sheltered view of the lower outcropping and bogs below. Bits of rotting leather and pockmarked stones half-buried in the thin soil show that others have done a fair amount of watching here as well.

node.name: Galduta Isharon, The West Face
node.description: The view north looks like nature's chaotic side was inspired to rend the bedrock itself, heaving the land up, gradually at first but culminating in a towering height hundreds of feet in the air. Like a serpent attacking the feet of a giant, the river to the west rages over rapids, pounding against the rock in an angry competition between the two elements.

The view north looks like nature's chaotic side was inspired to rend the bedrock itself, heaving the land up, gradually at first but culminating in a towering height hundreds of feet in the air. Like a serpent attacking the feet of a giant, the river to the west rages over rapids, pounding against the rock in an angry competition between the two elements. Along the rapids, shadows collect in hollows that mark the river's slow victory in the struggle between water and earth.

node.name: Galduta Isharon, The West Face
node.description: The ledge must be above the river -- far above, to judge by the sound. The ground slopes down to the west, and on the ledge itself, massive boulders define a trail that rises to the north and east. Far to the north, a shadow darker than night juts high into the air.

Part of the edge of the path has fallen away, and a broken slope leads down to the west. On what remains of the ledge, massive boulders define a trail that rises to the north and east. Far to the north is the summit of the outcropping, a sharp peak dominating the rugged landscape.

node.name: The West Face, A Broken Slope
node.description: The slope ends sharply, jutting out at a dizzying height above the river. The debris from the rockslide clutters the area except where it has fallen down a narrow channel, carved into the face of the rock, that allows a switchbacked route toward the river below.

node.name: Galduta Isharon, The West Face
node.description: The broader expanse of rock to the southwest tilts and sharpens to the north, as if the outcropping itself resisted further efforts to scale its imposing face. It must have taken persevering labor to forge the narrow path that struggles the north and south route. A roughly carved niche in the eastern face of the rocky wall offers more evidence that the path was the work of hands, not nature.

node.name: Galduta Isharon, The West Face
node.description: The narrow path skirts the edge of the rocky outcropping, ending in a sharp peak rising black against the night sky to the northeast. The trail blends into the face of the rock like a scar from a long forgotten wound. Along the western edge of the trail, a patchwork of lichens and stubborn mosses, some glowing with a pale phosphorescence, drinks in the moisture rising from the river far below.

The narrow path skirts the edge of the rocky outcropping, ending in a sharp peak to the northeast. The trail blends into the face of the rock like a scar from a long forgotten wound. Along the western edge of the trail, a patchwork of lichens and stubborn mosses drinks in the moisture rising from the river far below.

node.name: Galduta Isharon, A Narrow Ledge
node.description: The main outcropping divides spectacularly as the land rises to a peak like a huge spike driven into the earth between the rugged outcrop to the southeast and a black line to the southwest, from where rises the sound of raging water far below. A dimly seen small ledge to the north seems almost an afterthought compared to this rocky finger pointing defiantly at the heavens.

The main outcropping divides spectacularly as the land rises to a peak like a huge spike driven into the earth between the rugged outcrop to the southeast and the cliff edge to the southwest. A small ledge to the north seems almost an afterthought compared to this rocky finger pointing defiantly at the heavens.

node.name: Galduta Isharon, A Narrow Ledge
node.description: A small ledge here clings desperately to the main outcropping, overlooking a vast dark emptiness. A step onto the ledge dislodges small bits of scree that skid across and down to fall in silence into the darkness -- the ledge is fighting a losing battle against weather and time. From far below in the silence comes the barest sound of water roiling and churning.

A small ledge clings desperately to the main outcropping, overlooking a dangerously entrancing vista hundreds of feet below. A step onto the ledge dislodges bits of scree that skid across and down to fall in silence into the roiling waters of the river -- the ledge is fighting a losing battle against weather and time. Beyond the churning waters lies the far side of the river: a vast, barren expanse empty of signs of habitation.

node.name: Galduta Isharon, The East Face
node.description: The trail levels out slightly, as if gathering energy before rising toward the pinnacle of the outcropping to the northwest. Empty roosts are scattered among the crags, many of them with broken eggshells.

node.name: Galduta Isharon, The East Face
node.description: Midway up the face of the outcropping, a cleft in the stone provides shelter from the wind howling unchecked across the face of the mountain. Water from a small spring bubbles into a pool at the back of the cleft and trickles down the slope. Next to the pool is a crude firepit whose ashes suggest recent use. Charred bones lie strewn about the outer edge of the cleft, away from some flattened indentations in the rough ground circling the firepit.

node.name: Lish'telga, Wooded Slopes
node.description: Though straight and sturdy, the trees lean with the sharp downward pitch of the land, each limb on their northern sides farther from the ground than those on their southern sides. From those heights, a shower of needles, leaves and limbs falls, set into a whirling plunge of motion with every buffet of wind. The debris races down the hillside, lost from sight as its descent takes it beneath the interposing branches of the valley below.

node.name: Lish'telga, Wooded Slopes
node.description: Covering the angled banks of the sloped ground, a lush beard of grass thickens the humps of the trail. As real whiskers might hide an unsavory profile, so does the hefty growth in this wood disguise the rough, rocky surface of the land. The trees have little problem with the stone-ridden ground, growing tall and strong, surely making for a different scale of metaphorical beard to viewers on the other hills and mountains.

node.name: Lish'telga, Wooded Slopes
node.description: Riddled with plant life as the trail may be, a hazy grey peak in the Undogoz mountains manages to rise into view and out of the trees' concealment. Though distant, the glimpses of sheer cliffs and bare stone humble any comparison of the slanting footpath winding in these hills. Folly it would be to travel upon those dangerous crags, and the thought makes the steep, northern descent of this land quite manageable in contrast.

node.name: Lish'telga, Wooded Path
node.description: A wide selection of vegetation clusters at the base of every tree in the forest, ranging from ferns and flowers to ivy and vines. The ash enriched soil at the foot of the Undogoz chain is most likely responsible for the rampant growth, yet the view of the nearest slope through the trees reveals a relatively barren surface. Sheltered from the high cliff's strong winds, the wooded path has become a botanist's dream.

node.name: Lish'telga, Wooded Slopes
node.description: Surrounded by a cul-de-sac of living greenery, thick grass blades wave in unison under the brisk mountain zephyrs. Several types of brightly colored wildflower nestle in the grass, seen only when an appropriate breeze shoves the interposing blades out of the way. The gentle rustling is constant, but rises and falls in tempo with nature, its conductor.

node.name: Lish'telga, Wooded Path
node.description: The heady scent of soil and plant life fills the air, only to be whisked temporarily away with each swirling breeze. As the wind blows, ferns nod and branches sway, as if to shoo the thick smells of earth. Losing leaves and needles with the motion, the waving of the plants reaches a crescendo before stillness descends on the area, and the scenario repeats.

node.name: Lish'telga Misekar, Lowlands
node.description: Quite out of place considering the environment, a broken stone arch rises from the weeds in the center of the path. Missing a Gor'Tog sized chunk from its keystone down, the arch looks liable to fall over under the slightest provocation. This may prove deceptive, however, as the steady winds and heavy growth of vines across its surface are seemingly unable to affect its position.

node.name: Lish'telga Misekar, Lowlands
node.description: Thick woods gradually thin to light forest and, finally, to occasional close growing clumps of trees in the northern wilds. The ground begins to rise rapidly and steeply to the north. Vanishing up in the hills, a faint path winds its way through the tall grasses.

node.name: Lish'telga Misekar, Lowlands
node.description: Higher in the hills, the forest sounds die away as the thick southern woods thin to sparsely wooded highland. The scattered growths cling tenuously to the earth, their wind-twisted trunks and branches betraying misery in the face of the surrounding greenery.

node.name: Lish'telga Misekar, Midlands
node.description: Thin trees and scruffy vegetation rise skyward like desperate worshipers of a unforgiving god, not thick enough to keep the path from being completely open to the sky. Winds snap through the area, hardly hindered by the clumps of dry pines -- in fact, the pines seem to be losing this battle, as every gust sends a shower of brittle needles sailing through the air.

node.name: Lish'telga Misekar, Midlands
node.description: A vacancy in the already thinning amount of woodland faces the western side of a cliff on the nearest of the Undogoz mountains, its surface barren and sheer, apparent even from this distance. Between here and there, a valley of thick woods blocks the ground from sight, covering any secrets therein. Secrets they shall remain, at least from here, as the climb below would be easily fatal to anything less skilled than a bird.

node.name: Lish'telga Misekar, Midlands
node.description: South and down, small trees supplant the sparse vegetation of the upper slopes, while the wind whistles incessantly through the bushes and rustles the grass. An odd outcrop of stone springs from the side of the hill, a contrast in size to the few cobblestones that poke up in disarray from the earth.

node.name: Lish'telga Misekar, Highlands
node.description: Varieties of grass and thistle cluster into the patches of soil between the grey of exposed rocks. Whipped relentlessly by nature for an untold time, the stones and boulders bear many a scar of their years upon the upper elevations. Splintered and cracked, they still manage to remain, defiant to the plants which strangle them for living space.

node.name: Lish'telga Misekar, Highlands
node.description: Craggy rocks crouch along the trail as if huddling from the ferocity of the mountain winds. The low positions of the stone refugees does help keep them sheltered from the worst weathering gusts, but does not spare them the growths of thorny thistles around their bases. In some places these tenacious plants cover the rocks completely, only humped mounds indicating the stones' places.

node.name: Lish'telga Misekar, Highlands
node.description: Only a few ragged shrubs dot the landscape, while the neighboring foothills of the Undogoz mountain chain are barren of feature. The tall grasses of the mid- and lowlands have given way to a short-bladed turf creeping over the sloped ground. Partially sunken into the earth, an old stone road curves north toward a ridge, its cobblestones obscured by dirt and weeds to the south.

node.name: Escarpment, Slope Peak
node.description: At the crest of a hill, the ground suddenly falls away, dropping precipitously down the sharp edge of a high cliff. The rim of the escarpment runs east and west, perpendicular to the jagged and worn cobblestones of an ancient road. Peeking from the clumps of grass, the stones reveal the road as a rough outline winding away from the edge of the drop.

node.name: Escarpment, Overlook Ledge
node.description: A slab of rock juts from the steep face of the escarpment, providing a convenient spot for rest. Twisted by the wind, a sturdy tree clings tenaciously to the scant purchase of the overhang, digging its slender roots into the tiny cracks where the massive slab of stone meets the cliff wall. On one side of the ledge, a slender crack runs vertically up and down the cliff.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The White Oak
node.description: Halfway up the ancient oak, its enormous limbs form highways in the sky for the creatures of the canopy. The weathered walkways cast dark shadows over the marsh below. A leaf drifts down, taking a long time to fall, slowed in its descent by the rising bog gasses that clog and taint the air.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The White Oak
node.description: The limb groans under the unaccustomed weight of visitors. Something has stripped the branch of its bark, maybe the insect larvae of a wood-boring beetle that now infest the creaking limb, making every step both distasteful and dangerous. A plump, white grub inches its way to a richer feeding spot, and disappears into the limb.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The White Oak
node.description: Sunlight breaks through the canopy above, painting the branch with patches of light and shadow. Only the rising stench from the bog below spoils the temptation to lie back and enjoy the sight.

node.name: Fala Inisharon, The White Oak
node.description: Deep claw marks, signs of nature red in tooth and claw, scar the wide branch near a broken arrow lodged in the wood. The archer must have missed his target, because bloodstains streak the limb and the leaves below. A large vine twists down from a vine-covered cypress to the south.

node.name: The Galley Sanegazat
node.description: The galley, like its twin, carries passengers and cargo, but it can easily become a war galley. Brackets for catapults and a reinforced prow for mounting a ram show its military use, part of the reason why the rowers are trained and willing volunteers for this hard service.

node.name: The Galley Cercorim
node.description: Passengers and cargo crowd the deck of the sleek, black galley. Below, visible through the large opening amidships, sit the tanned and muscular rowers, one shift at the oars while the other rests. The exhorter sits in the stern behind his drum, ready to speed or slacken the rhythm as needed.

node.name: Old Trail, A Box Canyon
node.description: With the trail ending abruptly at this serene grove, shrubs and ferns surround a lone oak tree which stands as a monument to the artistry involved in the creation of Elanthia. Small creatures play hide-and-seek from you as they look for a place that makes them feel safe from your sight.

node.name: Old Trail, Lean-To
node.description: This shaky shelter of twigs and brush has been haphazardly stitched to the main structure with cotton rags. A trunk to one side holds used tack, and near to it is a basket containing some old grooming supplies. A box of feed rests in a corner.

node.name: Old Trail, Stable
node.description: Straw dust and the sweet scent of horse manure coat the air. The brush and twig walls keep out the worst of the weather and any night-roaming creatures. Overhead, the soft glow of a lantern dangling from the thatched roof disperses the dark. Low straw barriers protruding from the walls section off individual stalls for the horses, and a corral is visible through a split tarp hanging across the back wall.

node.name: Fold with Care, Main Room
node.description: Precious little adornment graces this hastily erected tent. A lamp hanging from the central post provides light and a ratty old rug keeps the dirt off the customer's feet. The tent walls have a scattering of diagrams pinned to them, each a charcoal rendition of origami fold techniques.

node.name: Fold with Care, Metallic Papers
node.description: Precious little adornment graces this hastily erected tent. A lamp hanging from the central post provides light and a ratty old rug keeps the dirt off the customer's feet. The tent walls have a scattering of diagrams pinned to them, each a charcoal rendition of origami fold techniques.

node.name: Fold with Care, Patterned Papers
node.description: Precious little adornment graces this hastily erected tent. A lamp hanging from the central post provides light and a ratty old rug keeps the dirt off the customer's feet. The tent walls have a scattering of diagrams pinned to them, each a charcoal rendition of origami fold techniques.

node.name: Fold with Care, Dyed Papers
node.description: Precious little adornment graces this hastily erected tent. A lamp hanging from the central post provides light and a ratty old rug keeps the dirt off the customer's feet. The tent walls have a scattering of diagrams pinned to them, each a charcoal rendition of origami fold techniques.

node.name: Fold with Care, Dyed Papers
node.description: Precious little adornment graces this hastily erected tent. A lamp hanging from the central post provides light and a ratty old rug keeps the dirt off the customer's feet. The tent walls have a scattering of diagrams pinned to them, each a charcoal rendition of origami fold techniques.

node.name: Fold with Care, Dyed Papers
node.description: Precious little adornment graces this hastily erected tent. A lamp hanging from the central post provides light and a ratty old rug keeps the dirt off the customer's feet. The tent walls have a scattering of diagrams pinned to them, each a charcoal rendition of origami fold techniques.

node.name: Fold with Care, Multi-Colored Envelopes
node.description: Precious little adornment graces this hastily erected tent. A lamp hanging from the central post provides light and a ratty old rug keeps the dirt off the customer's feet. The tent walls have a scattering of diagrams pinned to them, each a charcoal rendition of origami fold techniques.

node.name: Fold with Care, Blue and Green Envelopes
node.description: Precious little adornment graces this hastily erected tent. A lamp hanging from the central post provides light and a ratty old rug keeps the dirt off the customer's feet. The tent walls have a scattering of diagrams pinned to them, each a charcoal rendition of origami fold techniques.

node.name: Fold with Care, Red and Plain Envelopes
node.description: Precious little adornment graces this hastily erected tent. A lamp hanging from the central post provides light and a ratty old rug keeps the dirt off the customer's feet. The tent walls have a scattering of diagrams pinned to them, each a charcoal rendition of origami fold techniques.

node.name: Fever Point Pier, Upper Cross-bracing
node.description: Additions, both man-made and natural, have been added to the original builders' work over the years. One beam-end has a crude picture etched into it: two crossed scimitars set above a star. Twigs from dislodged nests are wedged into the pier's joints, and the whole structure has been eroded by brine. The lower cross-bracing offers a way back to the beach, but with a little luck and talent, it might be possible to climb onto protruding pier decking above.

node.name: Fever Point Pier, Lower Cross-bracing
node.description: The lower joints of the wooden cross-bracing smell like rotted fish and are slippery with bird droppings. Several feet up, the upper cross-bracing runs just below the heavy beams supporting the pier's plank decking. Looking below, the sandy beach emerges from beneath its rocky covering and winds in a lazy arc away from the piling toward a line of trees.

node.name: Fever Point, Zhendil's Emporium
node.description: A portable sorting table with compartments full of sparkling gems seems out of place in this musty room, with its walls and ceiling that look held together by cobwebs and wasp nests. Oiled paper tacked over one window frame creates a makeshift covering that blocks not only the elements, but also most of the light. Two barrels offer seating near the counter where the gem dealer does business, and a ceiling lantern casts a glow whereby he is able to judge the character of his customers.

node.name: Penal Colony, Northwest Ring Road
node.description: To the southwest, the road runs through a covered bridge that crosses a deep gully. The bridge, barely wide enough for a wagon, has been laboriously pieced together from odd-sized planks cut from driftwood -- signs of both the scarcity of wood and the abundance of free labor.

node.name: Penal Colony, Northwest Ring Road
node.description: Torchlight throws black shadows on the looming bulk of the Colony fortress to the north. A lane leads up the hill to a deep-set gate, cast in shadow by flaring lanterns hung on either side.

node.name: Penal Colony, Northwest Ring Road
node.description: A little south of the fortress walls, the road already shows signs of its disuse. A well-travelled highway is always marked by litter, old campsites, fresh wheel-ruts, and animal droppings, none of which are in evidence here. To the west, a lane leads uphill to the fortress gate, and to the southeast, the road curves to avoid an inlet.

node.name: Penal Colony, Northwest Ring Road
node.description: The ancient road, once a thoroughfare along M'Riss's north shore, is surrendering to the elements. Paving stones cracked and heaved up by frost lie half-buried in sand blown by the constant northwest winds, and a grey-green moss covers their leeward side.

node.name: Penal Colony, Northwest Ring Road
node.description: To the east the road disappears abruptly: the tides have washed away its foundation, and a big section of the paving has simply slid into the encroaching sea. Not that anyone seems to mind -- there's no sign that traffic has headed eastward in a long, long time.

node.name: Penal Colony, Northwest Ring Road
node.description: A few torches burn atop the Colony Fortress's South Wall. The shadows they cast partly hide the deep-set Desert Gate. A lane leads from the gate downhill to where the Island Ring Road bypasses the colony, southwest to northeast. Aside from a large flat rock and a few scrubby patches of sea-oats, the area is barren.

node.name: Penal Colony, Below the South Wall
node.description: Just to the west of the Desert Gate lies a small flowerbed outlined with whitewashed stones. Someone has tried to nurture a bit of color in the shelter of the wall, providing the daily water and weeding needed.

node.name: Penal Colony, Below the Bay Bastion
node.description: This shadowed corner where the south and the bay walls meet has become the home of weeds, the seeds brought by passing gulls and sheltered from the desert winds. The land slopes steeply down from the fortress wall.

node.name: Penal Colony, Below the South Wall
node.description: The ground drops off below the south wall, almost as if someone had planned a moat and begun the digging, only to abandon the job. Now the desert sands have sifted in, leaving only a curiously regular depression like a dry riverbed.

node.name: Penal Colony, Below the Desert Bastion
node.description: The high tower of the Desert Bastion faces rank on rank of dunes receding into the distance. The wind picks up swirls of sand from their tops, shifting the sands in a slow procession. If not for the hazy mountains to the southeast, one could believe that the desert went on forever.

node.name: Penal Colony, Below the East Wall
node.description: A wide cleared area stretches along the wall from the beach to the north to the desert in the south. Here, some lazy or careless hand has tossed rubbish from the fortress, and it lies piled at the base of the wall, buzzing with flies.

node.name: Penal Colony, Below the East Wall
node.description: As the coastline curves to the east, the dunes give way to a barren, rock-strewn headland, dotted with shallow dips and hollows. Only an occasional stunted tree or low bush has been spared the clearing of the ground outside the fortress walls.

node.name: Penal Colony, Below the East Wall
node.description: The wind whistles and swirls around the Lee Bastion to the north, scouring its seaward face, but in the shelter of the eastern wall huddle a few greyish-green creepers. The vines, none thicker than a little finger, scratch out a meager living among the rocks, shells, and sand.

node.name: Penal Colony, Below the Lee Bastion
node.description: The mighty Lee Bastion anchors the northeast corner of the fortress. Arrow slits pierce its walls high above and the deep shadows in their recesses hint at the thickness and strength of its masonry.

node.name: Penal Colony, Below the North Wall
node.description: Clumps of sea oats rise from dunes as high as a Halfling. The dunes follow the shoreline to the west, curving gradually around the prominence on which the fortress stands. Its walls rise to the south, weathered from the steady ocean winds.

node.name: Hidisharon Desert, Dunes
node.description: Tiny reflections of the sun are visible everywhere in the sand. The brilliant glare combines with the oppressive heat and the forceful wind in an attempt to beat trespassers into submission.

node.name: Hidisharon Desert, Dunes
node.description: Giant dunes of pale sand block your vision in every direction. Gusts of hot wind send clouds of sand billowing across the landscape, some thick enough to blind you temporarily, others merely hitting you with stinging force.

node.name: Hidisharon Desert, Dunes
node.description: Every part of exposed flesh is mercilessly subjected to the stinging sand, as each new gust of wind forces giant handfuls airborne.

node.name: Hidisharon Desert, Dunes
node.description: The harsh desert stretches endlessly in every direction. Walking is difficult in the loose sand, but an occasional rock provides firmer footing. The heat is as endless as the desert, parching the throat and drying the mouth.

node.name: Hidisharon Desert, Dunes
node.description: The monotonous sand dunes are the only thing in sight. The sun fills this land with tremendous heat, deadly to the careless.

node.name: Hidisharon Desert, Dunes
node.description: The dunes frustratingly spread in all directions with no end in sight. The howling winds are occasionally broken by dead silence.

node.name: Hidisharon Desert, Dunes
node.description: Hot wind blows sand fiercely before itself, slowly reshaping the landscape. Each giant sand dune is constantly being built, destroyed, and moved to a new location. The lonely sound of the ever-present wind reinforces the feeling of utter isolation.

node.name: Hidisharon Desert, Dunes
node.description: Aptly named, this desert of despair has been the site of many deaths, though mostly for unfortunate animals. Suspicious-looking bones protruding from the side of a dune look very familiar.

node.name: Hidisharon Desert, Dunes
node.description: Tiny reflections of the sun are visible everywhere in the sand. The brilliant glare combines with the oppressive heat and the forceful wind in an attempt to beat trespassers into submission.

node.name: Hidisharon Desert, Dunes
node.description: The fierce winds drive the sand with painful force. The crest of each new sand dune reveals only more sand, more dunes. The dunes shimmer in the intense heat.

node.name: Hidisharon Desert, Dunes
node.description: Aptly named, this desert of despair has been the site of many deaths, though mostly for unfortunate animals. Suspicious-looking bones protruding from the side of a dune look very familiar.

node.name: Hidisharon Desert, Dunes
node.description: The desert seems dedicated to either forcing out intruders, or killing them. A few bones here and there in the sands are indications of its past achievements.

node.name: Hidisharon Desert, Dunes
node.description: Every part of exposed flesh is mercilessly subjected to the stinging sand, as each new gust of wind forces giant handfuls airborne.

node.name: Forlorn Hope, Clearing
node.description: A wall of rock encloses a small clearing that looks like time's battlefield. Strewn in front of a cave mouth are the rusty remains of helmets, shield bosses, buckles, and swords fused into a jagged carpet by the sediment of centuries. A careless step here means a twisted ankle or worse. The cave seems to go back some distance into the cliff face, and something appears to be scratched into the rock to one side of the opening.

node.name: Forlorn Hope, Cavern
node.description: The brook running from the slopes outside finds an entrance into the cliff face here. Eons of trickling water have worn a fair-sized chamber into the porous limestone. Near the back of the room, the stream disappears into a mossy crevice, dropping to who-knows-what depths below. To either side of the crevice, watercourses long since diverted have washed out even larger openings in the rock.

node.name: Forlorn Hope, Cavern
node.description: This room, the largest by far, has the feeling of a long-abandoned campsite about it, one left in a hurry. On the upward sloping floor lie rusted buckles, cooking pots, a lantern -- even a good-luck charm perhaps cast off in disgust. Time and sediment have frozen them all where they fell. Some effort was made to pile the gear near the walls, leaving the center clear of the worst of the clutter.

node.name: Forlorn Hope, Alcove
node.description: A niche, a little above the level of the main chamber, is the driest spot in the cave, and from its vantage the whole room below is visible. It sits empty, silent, almost waiting. Some nameless bygone visitor left only one trace: from one of the walls, a bundle of papers juts out, wedged tightly into a crack.

node.name: Forlorn Hope, Cavern
node.description: An arm of the stream trickles into a pool the size of a public bath. The glassy surface of the water reflects the dim light from the entrance, casting cold shadows on walls and ceiling.

node.name: Forlorn Hope, The Pool
node.description: The water is cold, almost bone-numbing at first. Every stroke of the swimmer sends ripples across the smooth face of the pool. The waves strike against the cave walls and shore with soft, echoing slaps. A dark shape lies deep below the surface at the far end.

node.name: Forlorn Hope, Pool
node.description: Luminescent plants growing from the wall crevices below cast a soft glow. Their waving tendrils create odd-shaped shadows at the bottom of the pool, which is deeper than it appeared from the safety of the pool's edge. Above, the light from the cave clashes with the water's surface, creating an opaque silvery barrier that distorts visibility.

node.name: Forlorn Hope, Pool
node.description: Pairs and trios of pale fish meander among the swaying plants, pausing to nibble at the vegetation and occasionally, at each other. The walls of the pool are split with crevices and shaded with uneven stone. Further below, a dark shape lies at one side of the pool.

node.name: Forlorn Hope, Pool
node.description: Like soft mud clawed by a badger, deep fissures are gouged into the hard rock on one side of the pool's wall. A strong current flows from the network of crevices toward the dark shape opposite. Below, what appeared from the surface to be a pebble floor proves to be a scattering of large rocks embedded in silt.

node.name: Forlorn Hope, Pool Bottom
node.description: The plants clinging to the rough walls glow more brightly than their smaller cousins living in more shallow depths, as if the greater water pressure squeezes forth more light. Tiny strands of debris descend feather-like from above, in time creating the soft padding of silt that softens the rocky floor of the pool.

node.name: Forlorn Hope, Tunnel
node.description: A rocky overhang at the tunnel's mouth blocks most of the glow from the plants outside. Water completely fills the tunnel, giving no chance to gasp a lungful of air. The current pushes hard toward the darkness beyond.

node.name: Forlorn Hope, Tunnel
node.description: Visibility is limited to arm's length, but occasional streaks of light dart by: the sparkle of luminescent fish. The walls are coated with plants, their fronds swishing as the current presses upward.

node.name: Forlorn Hope, Tunnel
node.description: There's air here! And the luminescent moss coating the tunnel walls casts a dull twilight, revealing a large cave with a ledge seeming to float just above the water. The tunnel is lower to the east, but the ceiling doesn't quite touch the stream.

node.name: Forlorn Hope, Tunnel
node.description: Tangles of luminescent moss span the narrow space between ceiling and water's surface. The quickening current presses to the southeast, accompanied by loud gurgling as the stream slaps against the tunnel walls.

node.name: Forlorn Hope, Tunnel
node.description: Patches of tree roots intrude on the glowing moss growing on the ceiling and walls. The tunnel takes a sharp dip downward, expanding the space between ceiling and stream surface. Water careening against the tunnel walls roars from the darkness below.

node.name: Forlorn Hope, Tunnel Rapids
node.description: Water swirls around a tumble of rocks fallen from the roof, sending sheets of mist into the air. The tunnel is darker here, removed from the soft glow given off by the moss. A trick of the light against some tree roots gives the impression of a great fish with its mouth open, showing three sharp teeth.

node.name: Forlorn Hope, Tunnel Rapids
node.description: The water thunders as it surges from above down this dark boulder-strewn channel. The foaming stream carries with it bits of glowing moss and luminescent tendrils that cause the frothing surface to sparkle. The current, not as insistent as the tumble down the rapids, flows urgently southward.

node.name: Forlorn Hope, Cascade Shelf
node.description: Sediment and luminescent foam fold together in the churning water. The rapids spill into this deep pool, scooped out of the soft earth by years of rough flow. In the more shallow, calmer part of the pool, fish swim among the aquatic plants swaying in the current.

node.name: Forlorn Hope, Deluge
node.description: Excavated loam swirling in the strong currents darkens the water and cloaks the tunnel's depths. Specks of glittering minerals occasionally catch a hint of light and illuminate the rushing movements of the deluge.

node.name: Forlorn Hope, Deluge
node.description: Relentless torrents of water push down from the rapids above and surge up again from below. Sinuous roots whip violently in the crosscurrents, slashing or embrangling whatever comes too close.

node.name: Forlorn Hope, Deluge
node.description: The earthen walls press inward as the pounding waters tumble you in a dark and breathless world.

node.name: Forlorn Hope, Deluge
node.description: Rocks and debris swirl in the fierce currents, slowly abrading their way ever deeper into the earth. A vague glow invades the deep shadow of the deluge bottom, outlining the toothy stone walls of the tunnel.

node.name: Forlorn Hope, Grotto
node.description: Softly fluorescing moss clinging to the stone overhead washes the mist-laden air of the grotto in pale green light. Veined seedpods hang languidly from vines that twist through the crenellated maze of stone above.

node.name: Forlorn Hope, Ledge
node.description: The ledge juts from the wall at an upward angle, making for a difficult climb and hiding anyone who might be crouched beyond its rough lip. Surprisingly broad, the ledge runs almost the length of this broad chamber. Several scorched spots and a pile of refuse, including fish bones, hint at past use.

node.name: Forlorn Hope, Underground
node.description: Overhead, large tree roots dangle from the thin layer of earth that composes the roof. Subtle light filtering through the crevices in the walls illuminates not only the cave, but also highlights the muddy footprints leading to and from the pool's edge.
