The stream emerges from the pool at the far end of the area, and disappears through a split in the rock. A boulder near the stream is etched with three long scratches pointing toward the cracked rock.

node.name: Fang Cove, Fate's Fortune Lane
node.description: A towering marble archway opens a gap in the wall to the north and separates the ongoing construction and somewhat more refined completed structures of Fate's Fortune Lane from the crude structures and makeshift walkway along the beach. The entrance to a squat, wide bungalow sits in opposition to the arch, and the sheltering cliffs of Fang's Peak rise up from behind it. To either side of the arch, cobblestones of different shapes and sizes have been laid out to form the wide Fate's Fortune Lane.

node.name: Hidisharon Desert, Dry Ditch
node.description: Most likely carved by wind rather than rain, a dusty ditch undercuts the road, its bottom filled by grey and tan pebbles, its top edged with grainy sand. Curved as a worm might bend as it burrowed through the earth, the gulley arcs around several massive boulders embedded in the ground. Oddly square, the stones shoulder against one another, defying the wind and elements from stealing any more dry land from their domain.

node.name: Hidisharon Desert, Sandy Trail
node.description: Dry, brown grasses struggle to survive in the nooks and crevices of the surrounding stones, each day another desperate fight for existence. An easier time is had by the scores of tiny scorpions that scuttle between the rocks, lunging at whatever small prey they might find. The insects keep a fair distance, preferring to find their quarry within sheltered cracks and away from the wind-tossed sand of the trail.

node.name: Hidisharon Desert, Sandy Trail
node.description: Small tan rocks stand out from the swirling shades of dark sand, randomly settled into their positions by the elements, but striking a noticeable similiarity to a night sky. The stars are untouchable, yet the pebbles and stones are within an arm's reach away from being rearranged, playthings of some traveling mortal who fancies himself a god dabbling with constellations, or shifted by the vagaries of wind and nature.

node.name: Hidisharon Desert, Sandy Trail
node.description: Ripples of sand, curled not unlike discarded snake skins, fill the horizon to the south, sight beyond blurred by the shimmering air rising from the desert, night or day. Somewhere beyond the dunes are the peaks of the Undogoz mountain chain, their presence masked by distance and the waves of dancing heat so perfectly that one might wonder if the mountains are there at all.

node.name: Hidisharon Desert, Dune's Edge
node.description: Arched as though bitten by some giant mouth, a crescent-shaped depression dips into the dunes below, swallowing stones, rocks, and anything else too close to the flowing sand along its edge. When the wind blows, the wash of debris down its gullet actively hisses as it slides, falling silent again as the breezes cease. A weathered sign leans near the edge of the pit, only the thickness of its post keeping it stable.

node.name: Dunes of Despair, High Dunes
node.description: The dim illumination of the night reveals a sea of gentle dunes rippling into the distance. Shadowed troughs and highlighted dune crests mingle teasingly across the desert bed, relieving its otherwise stark emptiness.

An endless expanse of featureless waste stretches in all directions. In the distance, the desert floor merges with the sky in a hazy, shimmering blur. The steady breeze whips a spray of fine sand into the air, stinging open eyes.

node.name: Tavayon, Lake Bed
node.description: Hardened by hundreds of years under the intense heat of the sun, the vast expanse of silt is marred by an endless network of salt-encrusted cracks that form a kaleidoscope of geometric shapes. Jagged cliffs ring the dry lake bed, broken only by a faint trail leading northward and a towering plateau looming to the south.

node.name: Tavayon, Lake Bed
node.description: Hardened by hundreds of years under the intense heat of the sun, the vast expanse of silt is marred by an endless network of salt-encrusted cracks that form a kaleidoscope of geometric shapes. Jagged cliffs ring the dry lake bed and a towering plateau looms to the east.

node.name: Tavayon, Lake Bed
node.description: Hardened by hundreds of years under the intense heat of the sun, the vast expanse of silt is marred by an endless network of salt-encrusted cracks that form a kaleidoscope of geometric shapes. Jagged cliffs ring the dry lake bed and a towering plateau looms to the north.

node.name: Tavayon, Lake Bed
node.description: Hardened by hundreds of years under the intense heat of the sun, the vast expanse of silt is marred by an endless network of salt-encrusted cracks that form a kaleidoscope of geometric shapes. Jagged cliffs ring the dry lake bed and a deep crater lies to the north, though passage is obstructed by numerous spires of obsidian that jut high into the air.

node.name: Tavayon, Lake Bed
node.description: Hardened by hundreds of years under the intense heat of the sun, the vast expanse of silt is marred by an endless network of salt-encrusted cracks that form a kaleidoscope of geometric shapes. Jagged cliffs ring the dry lake bed and a deep crater lies to the west, though passage is obstructed by numerous spires of obsidian that jut high into the air.

node.name: Tavayon, Lake Bed
node.description: Hardened by hundreds of years under the intense heat of the sun, the vast expanse of silt is marred by an endless network of salt-encrusted cracks that form a kaleidoscope of geometric shapes. Jagged cliffs ring the dry lake bed and a deep crater lies to the south, which is surrounded by numerous spires of obsidian that jut high into the air.

node.name: Tavayon, Lake Bed
node.description: Hardened by hundreds of years under the intense heat of the sun, the vast expanse of silt is marred by an endless network of salt-encrusted cracks that form a kaleidoscope of geometric shapes. Jagged cliffs ring the dry lake bed and a towering plateau looms to the west. A deep crater lies to the east, though passage is obstructed by numerous spires of obsidian that jut high into the air.

node.name: Tavayon, Water's Edge
node.description: Numerous spires of obsidian jut around the rim of the crater and smaller fragments speckle the terrain, ranging from mere pebbles to colossal boulders taller than a Gor'Tog. Meager plant life struggles to eke out an existence in this bleak landscape, growing marginally more abundant as it approaches a brackish oasis to the south.

node.name: Tavayon, Water's Edge
node.description: Numerous spires of obsidian jut around the rim of the crater and smaller fragments speckle the terrain, ranging from mere pebbles to colossal boulders taller than a Gor'Tog. Meager plant life struggles to eke out an existence in this bleak landscape, growing marginally more abundant as it approaches a brackish oasis to the west.

node.name: Tavayon, Oasis
node.description: Shallow, brackish water offers life to the wretched plants that sprout around the shore. Several salt-encrusted chunks of obsidian spike up through the surface of the water.

node.name: Tavayon, Tumulus
node.description: Numerous spires of obsidian jut around the rim of the crater and smaller fragments speckle the terrain, ranging from mere pebbles to colossal boulders taller than a Gor'Tog. Meager plant life struggles to eke out an existence in this bleak landscape, growing marginally more abundant as it approaches a brackish oasis to the east.

node.name: Tavayon, Water's Edge
node.description: Numerous spires of obsidian jut around the rim of the crater and smaller fragments speckle the terrain, ranging from mere pebbles to colossal boulders taller than a Gor'Tog. Meager plant life struggles to eke out an existence in this bleak landscape, growing marginally more abundant as it approaches a brackish oasis to the north.

node.name: Tavayon, Plateau
node.description: Towering over the lake bed below, the ground here is mostly free of salt and speckled with sagebrush. The edge of the rock cuts in here somewhat, offering a possible descent down the face of the plateau.

node.name: Tavayon, Plateau
node.description: Towering over the lake bed below, the ground here is mostly free of salt and speckled with sagebrush. A lone tree leans over the edge of the plateau, its withered roots exposed through crumbling dirt.

node.name: Tavayon, Plateau
node.description: Towering over the lake bed below, the ground here is mostly free of salt and speckled with sagebrush. The edge of the rock cuts in here somewhat, offering a possible descent down the face of the plateau.

node.name: Tavayon, Plateau
node.description: Towering over the lake bed below, the ground here is mostly free of salt and speckled with sagebrush. Visible to the east is a deep crater in the lake bed ringed by obsidian spires.

node.name: The West Face, A Narrow Channel
node.description: The channel bears signs of having been at least improved, if not created, by intention. In some places, small steps have been hacked in the rock, but either the project was unfinished or it was intended for some creature whose limbs are hard to imagine.

node.name: The West Face, A Rocky Ledge
node.description: Midway up the cliff face juts a rocky ledge, only a few feet wide and perhaps ten or twelve feet long. Above it, a narrow channel carved into the rock leads upwards out of sight. Further to the east, a much steeper and natural-looking crevice in the rock leads downward to the river bank.

node.name: The West Face, A Rocky Ledge
node.description: Midway up the cliff face juts a rocky ledge, only a few feet wide and perhaps ten or twelve feet long. Below it, a narrow crevice in the rock leads downward to the river bank. Further to the west, a channel in the cliff face leads upward out of sight.

label.text: you'll eventually find your way out
